column5: I used to go to BI Lodge every year back when I was in grade school. The last trip was made back in 1988. I am thinking of going back next year with my father but have heard (probably not from reliable sources) that fishing in the McGregor Bay/Bay Finn area is not good. Anybody have any reports on that area? -Metz If people concentrated on the really important things in life, there'd be a shortage of fishing poles. --Doug Larson

Still good. My son caught the Junior World Record Walleye there last summer. Over 11 lbs when caught. Didn't get on a certified scale until we got home. Great Northern, Smallmouth & Musky too. Lots of big Rainbow are a bonus in May & June. Check out www.birchislandlodge.com

Hey BuckeyefeverDo you have pictures and a story of your son's fish. I would love to put that up on Birch Dale Lodge's web site. I designed and manage their web site. You can email the stuff to Greg or directly to me at [email protected] if you are interested.Gary
Where is this place? I tried to go to the web page, but it is apparently "closed for business". Is that a permanent thing?
The lodge was sold to a private entity in 2008. Fisherman Ted
HiBirch Island Lodge is out of businessgary
